resources.string:
How do you quit apps?
Tapping Back always means that you want to quit.
Tapping Home or Overview will put apps into the background.

Brevent recognizes the states of apps in this way, preventing apps in Brevent list from running for a long time.

When you tap Back to quit apps, apps and depending services won\'t run anymore; tap Home or Overview, or just put apps into the background, apps and depending services will keep running; swipe off apps from the Recents screen, apps will be force-stopped. Whenever apps are being run without activity, Brevent will force-stop them.\n\nApps in Brevent list can be set with \"allow sync\" option to receive notifications or execute jobs and syncs. Brevent won\'t standby \"allow sync\" apps, and Brevent won\'t force-stop \"allow sync\" apps with notifications or running in the background.
What do you need to do? \nJust enter a simple command via ADB on your PC.
Brevent won\'t work if Android-powered device reboots. Since Android 8, Brevent won\'t work if you turn off \"USB Debugging\" or change USB options.
Brevent does not need root access or the ability to modify system files, there is no residue after uninstallation.

Brevent uses plenty of Android\'s hidden APIs. Some third-party ROMs may modify these APIs, so there would be some issues while using Brevent with these ROMs.\n\nDO NOT use Brevent on work devices OR BREVENT work apps, frequently used apps or important apps.
Enjoy Brevent, and if you find any issues, please feel free to send feedback with logs.

The default Brevent method is \"Standby, then force-stop\". Standby (since Android 6.0, unsupported on some devices) apps can\'t access network or execute jobs or syncs.\n\nBrevent won\'t force-stop safe apps. In addition, Brevent server brevents apps centrally and delays the processes by 3 to 60 seconds, according to the event level.

ADB (Android Debug Bridge) is a command-line tool that lets a PC communicate with an Android device. It\'s part of platform-tools, you can download it here: https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/platform-tools (long-press to select and copy).

1. Decompress platform-tools-latest-<platform>.zip

2. Navigate to platform-tools directory

3. (for Windows) Hold Shift key, then right-click, choose "Open command window here", then use ".\adb" to replace the hinted "adb" (please remove duplicate "adb" before pasting into the command line)

3. (for macOS) Navigate to "Finder", "Applications", "Utilities", launch "Terminal", drag "adb" into the "Terminal", then use "adb" with full path to replace the hinted "adb" (please remove duplicate "adb" before pasting into the command line)

4. You need to use ADB every time you turn on your device, please avoid restarting or shutting down your device as much as possible

1. Turn on "Developer options", enable "USB debugging" %1$s

2. Connect to PC via USB %2$s

3. Execute in PC's command line "adb devices", make sure your PC can recognize your device (Reader "Guide - ADB")

4. Execute in PC's command line "%3$s"
It seems that your device is rooted. You can turn on network ADB manually, or try tapping the \"Root\" button in Brevent.\n\nRoot is unnecessary for Brevent, and requires payment.
Network ADB is turned on, please tap \"ADB\" to start Brevent Server.
Root is unnecessary for Brevent, and requires payment.
Brevent server started successfully. Please tap app icons to choose, then brevent them.
Brevent server is not started. Brevent is in read-only mode.
Retrieving process status, just a moment. . .
Starting Brevent server, just a moment. . .
Checking Brevent server, just a moment. . .
Uninstalling (keep data) will remove the package, but keep the data and cache directories.\n\nDo you confirm?
Uninstalling will remove the data and cache directories.\n\nDo you confirm?
Feel free to send feedback.\n\nIf you have a GitHub account, please create an issue; you can view opened issues too.%s
Brevent only applies to apps in Brevent list

Standby when you exit apps (tap \"Back\"), or background apps are timed out; force-stop when apps reach inactive timeout, or swipe off apps from the recents screen\n\nAlways force-stop running apps without activity
Standby when you exit apps (tap \"Back\"), or background apps are timed out\n\nAlways force-stop running apps without activity
Force-stop when apps reach inactive timeout, or swipe off apps from the recents screen\n\nAlways force-stop running apps without activity
Background apps will be brevented after %s\n\nBrevent shows inactive time for background apps dynamically
Force-stop when apps have been inactive for %1$s
All apps that have the same signature as Android Framework
WTF, all apps are framework apps
Including system and core apps which cannot be launched or upgraded
Add to Battery Optimization whitelist, make it receive messages as far as possible
Won\'t be brevented while playing with notification, won\'t be force-stopped if paused with notification\n\nDoes not work on some ROMs. May cause some samsung devices to reboot
If an app with notifications runs as a service, set it to aggressive.
Android OS apps cannot be brevented
Thanks for paying %s Brefoil via Play Store
Thanks for priceless contribution to Brevent
Thanks for paying %1$s Brefoil via Play Store, %2$s Brefoil via non Play Store
Thanks for paying %s Brefoil via Play Store, and priceless contribution to Brevent
Thanks for paying %s Brefoil, and priceless contribution on Brevent
Thanks for paying %1$s Brefoil via Play Store, %2$s Brefoil via non Play Store, and priceless contribution to Brevent
Be careful, may cause apps to crash
Disabled apps must be enabled to use
Enable and disable brevented GMS (Google Play services) dynamically
Update Brevent list when apps are installed or uninstalled
Notify if force-stop is too frequent
Don\'t force-stop widgets if you want them to work

Standby: %1$s
Stopped state: %2$s
Auto update: %3$s
Auto brevent: %4$s
App ops: %5$s
Disable Apps: %6$s
Suspend Apps: %7$s
DKOUT, Aviraxp, Li Yufan, TacoTheDank, Késmárky Tímea
Brevent is only available for Owner.
Brevent is unavailable in App clone.
Brevent cannot work well on modified devices.\n\nFor stock ROM, please \"Feedback\" - \"Logs\".
No permission to access Brevent server.\n\nTop apps: %1$s.
No event log, Brevent server cannot work automatically.\n\nPlease try later, or contact ROM provider.
No event log since %1$s, Brevent server cannot work automatically.\n\nPlease restart Brevent server or contact ROM provider.
Brevent server is upgrading. Please try again later.
Cannot get logs. Please try again later.
Since Android 8, Brevent server will stop working whenever \"USB Debugging\" turns off.\n\nDon\'t turn off \"USB debugging\", don\'t change USB options.
Brevent server has no sufficient permissions; some features are unavailable.
Invalid location for Brevent; please reinstall.
You have brevented important apps: %1$s.\n\nDo you want to unbrevent them?
You have brevented apps which cannot be launched: %1$s.\n\nDo you want to unbrevent them?
You seem to have activated Brevent Server in an unauthorized way.
Apps are marked as GMS App.
Apps are allowed to receive messages via sync, broadcast, and FCM (Firebase Cloud Messaging).
Apps are allowed to receive messages via sync or broadcast.
Apps are in aggressive mode. Normally, brevented apps can run for several seconds for dependency check; in aggressive mode, background apps would be force-stopped directly.
Apps won\'t be set as aggressive automatically.
Apps are disabled, must be enabled to use.
Apps are running temporarily, will be disabled later.
Brevent won\'t force-stop connected VPN apps.
Brevent won\'t force-stop paused apps with notifications.
Apps are in Battery Optimization whitelist, won\'t standby.
Safe apps. You shouldn\'t regard them as running.
Apps are on standby, will be force-stopped when they reach \"inactive timeout\" or swiped off from the recents screen.
Apps are running with foreground service, won\'t be brevented.
\"Allow sync\" apps are running in the background, won\'t be brevented.
Apps will be put to standby when they reach \"background apps timeout\", force-stopped when they reach \"inactive timeout\" or swiped off from the recents screen.
If apps are launched, will be put to standby in a short time, force-stopped when they reach \"inactive timeout\" or swiped off from recents screen. Otherwise, will be force-stopped in a short time.
Failed to unbrevent \"%1$s\", please launch Brevent
Failed to unset \"%1$s\", please launch Brevent
Brevented %1$d times in %2$s, tap to unbrevent.
Brevented %1$d times in %2$s, tap to disable.
Failed to disable \"%1$s\", please launch Brevent
Exec command only supports simple shell script, use it at your own risk.
Enable and disable apps via Brevent server
You have paid %d Brefoil. Pay more to turn on experimental features.
You have paid %d Brefoil. It\'s unnecessary to pay more.
Cannot cache play payment, please check network
Cannot cache play payment, please try later
You have installed the latest version.
You have installed a beta version.
You must accept Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy to use Brevent. In short, Brevent will collect anonymous log data via Google Analytics for Firebase.
Sort by \"%1$s" requires payment. Would you like to pay now?
